sentence: As CNN's Zanona points out, controversial Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) is already in line to take over the chairmanship of the powerful House Judiciary Committee "with all the subpoena power that comes with it."
author: Tom Boggioni
title: Freedom Caucus plans to 'elevate' Taylor Greene and Boebert on committees after GOP retakes the House: report

sentence: Related: Jan. 6 committee puts fellow member of Congress in the hot seat White House Jan. 6 call log confirms what Jim Jordan couldn't—or wouldn't Kevin McCarthy's failure to act on Gosar and Greene's white nationalist flirtation says it all Republicans divided on whether to use Jan. 6 committee as tool of revenge or just kill it off McConnell finally gets around to taking issue with RNC's embrace of violence.
author: Laura Clawson
title: Freedom Caucus is poised to have serious sway if Republicans take the House

sentence: Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) celebrate the moment on Twitter: “Ohio just became the 23rd state in the nation to enact constitutional carry legislation.
author: The First
title: OHIO GREENLIGHTS CONSTITUTIONAL CARRY: Jordan Says ‘Big Win for Second Amendment’

sentence: Troy Nehls, a Texas Republican, simply wrote, “Make Twitter Great Again,” while Rep. Jim Jordan praised Musk on Fox, painting him as the embodiment of “free speech.” Last Saturday, Musk rejected an offer from Twitter to join the company’s board—a move that would have barred him from acquiring a Twitter stake greater than 14.9%.
author: Caleb Ecarma
title: Right-Wingers Are Absolutely Eating Up the Idea of Elon Musk Taking Over Twitter

sentence: His call for more “free speech” on Twitter is being taken up with enthusiasm by conservatives like US Reps. Jim Jordan and Lauren Boebert, who see Musk as an ally in turning Twitter into a place where hateful and abusive speech are common and encouraged.
author: Noah Berlatsky
title: Elon Musk wants 'his speech to trump everyone else’s'

sentence: "Oh, McCarthy lied to us but I'm sure Jim Jordan won't."
author: NewsHound Ellen
title: McCarthy Was Caught Lying About Trump’s J6 Guilt. Now What?
